author: .vbuterin
content:
ok so I guess put in other ways my point is:

Present-day tools for decentralized history reading have failed. So we already know that either (i) we're going to build better tools for decentralized history reading in the future, or (ii) we're going to have mostly centralized history reading.

author: .vbuterin
content: Both paths imply moving away from present-day tools for decentralized history reading on some time-frame

author: .vbuterin
content: I guess the questions are (i) what's the time frame, and (ii) whether or not the chain should intentionally add features to make it easier to do decentralized history reading in the future

author: .vbuterin
content: An example of (ii) might be putting logs into polynomial commitments, so you could use simply use easy-to-construct proofs instead of bloom filters to access history more easily

author: sky.cactus

author: sky.cactus
content: As <@137094067015122944> mentioned above, The Graph isn't censorship resistant today, and they have had *plenty* of time to become censorship resistant yet they continue to not (as is the case for most projects, sadly).

author: sky.cactus
content: I suspect it will always be an "in the future" part of their roadmap, similar to censorship resistance for a lot of L2s will always be a "later" feature.

author: sky.cactus
content: As I always tell people, building actually censorship resistant dapps is quite challenging.

author: sky.cactus
content: Actually, I *do* think that logs are still useful, just not as "cheap long term storage".
